message.content:
**Analysis of the Main Target Image**

1. **Overall Count and Layers**

   - **Left‐Hand Structure (5 blocks total)**  
     •  Bottom layer: one tall green rectangular prism (a single “pillar”).  
     •  Middle layer: one wide yellow plank laid horizontally on top of the green pillar.  
     •  Above that: one red arch block spanning left‐to‐right.  
     •  Top layer (roof): two orange triangular wedges forming a peaked roof.

   - **Right‐Hand Structure (9 blocks total)**  
     •  Bottom layer: one wide yellow plank resting on the ground.  
     •  Next layer: two upright orange cylinders acting as columns.  
     •  Above the columns: another wide yellow plank as a platform.  
     •  On the platform: two blue cubes.  
     •  Spanning the cubes: one red arch block (again left‐to‐right).  
     •  Top layer (roof): two orange triangular wedges forming a peaked roof.

2. **Spatial Relationships**

   - The left structure is a single vertical “tower”: green pillar → yellow plank → red arch → triangular wedges on top.  
   - The right structure is a wider “temple”: yellow plank base → two orange columns → another yellow plank → two blue cubes supporting a red arch → two triangular wedges as the roof.

---

**Selecting Blocks From the Dictionary**

Below are the required block indices and the number of times each is used. (Note that we reuse the same index for identical blocks if needed, exactly as portrayed—no rotations different from the dictionary images.)

- **Red Arch**:  
  • Index #1 (used twice; one arch per structure)

- **Orange Roof Wedges**:  
  • Index #14 (used twice; left side of each peaked roof)  
  • Index #15 (used twice; right side of each peaked roof)

- **Green Pillar**:  
  • Index #7 (tall green rectangular prism, used once for the left structure)

- **Yellow Plank**:  
  • Index #9 (used three times total: one for the left structure, two for the right)

- **Blue Cube**:  
  • Index #4 (used twice for the right structure)

- **Orange Cylinder**:  
  • Index #10 (used twice, for the columns in the right structure)

---

**Assembly Order**

Below is one possible step‐by‐step sequence placing blocks from the ground up.  Use each block in exactly the orientation shown in the dictionary (no additional rotation):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 7   // Left green pillar  
  Step2:  Move block with index 9   // Yellow plank on the pillar (left structure)  
  Step3:  Move block with index 1   // Red arch atop the plank (left structure)  
  Step4:  Move block with index 14  // First orange wedge (left roof piece)  
  Step5:  Move block with index 15  // Second orange wedge (right roof piece)  

  Step6:  Move block with index 9   // Bottom yellow plank on the right structure  
  Step7:  Move block with index 10  // First orange cylinder  
  Step8:  Move block with index 10  // Second orange cylinder  
  Step9:  Move block with index 9   // Upper yellow plank on the columns  
  Step10: Move block with index 4   // First blue cube  
  Step11: Move block with index 4   // Second blue cube  
  Step12: Move block with index 1   // Red arch spanning the cubes  
  Step13: Move block with index 14  // Left wedge of the roof  
  Step14: Move block with index 15  // Right wedge of the roof  
}

By following the above list of blocks and this assembly order, you will recreate the two structures exactly as shown in the target image.
